metadata.feature_description: Manages placement and movement of modules within content layout columns/panes.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View Content Layout panes in Edit Mode

steps.action: Login as SuperUser and navigate to Home page
steps.expected: Login successful and Home page displayed
steps.actual: Login successful, Home page displayed with Evoq control panel

steps.action: Click Edit button to enable page Edit Mode
steps.expected: Page enters Edit Mode with pane labels visible
steps.actual: Edit Mode enabled, pane labels visible (TopHeroDark, TopPane, F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4)

steps.action: Scroll to view Content Layout columns
steps.expected: Four-column Content Layout visible with modules
steps.actual: Four-column layout visible: F30A_Pane1 (TELEVISIONS), F30A_Pane2 (WEARABLES), F30A_Pane3 (TABLETS), F30A_Pane4 (LAPTOPS)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Move module between Content Layout panes

steps.action: Hover over TABLETS module to see module action bar
steps.expected: Module action bar appears with Admin and Move options
steps.actual: Module action bar appeared showing '360:Tablets' with Admin and Move links

steps.action: Click Move link to see available pane destinations
steps.expected: Dropdown menu appears showing all available panes
steps.actual: Move menu displayed with options: Down, Bottom, To TopHeroDark, To TopPane, To topHero, To ContentPane, To LeftPane, To RightPane, To FooterPane, To F30A_Pane1, To F30A_Pane2, To F30A_Pane4, To 9977_Pane1-4

steps.action: Click 'To F30A_Pane1' to move TABLETS module to first column
steps.expected: TABLETS module moves from F30A_Pane3 to F30A_Pane1
steps.actual: TABLETS module successfully moved to F30A_Pane1, now stacked below TELEVISIONS module

steps.action: View F30A_Pane1 after moving TABLETS module
steps.expected: F30A_Pane1 contains two modules stacked vertically
steps.actual: F30A_Pane1 now contains TELEVISIONS (top) and TABLETS (bottom) modules stacked vertically

steps.action: View F30A_Pane3 after TABLETS module was moved out
steps.actual: F30A_Pane3 now empty, showing 'Click to add text', 'Click to add an image', 'Click to add a module' placeholder icons

steps.action: Check module order in F30A_Pane1 with multiple modules
steps.expected: Modules maintain their order within the pane
steps.actual: TELEVISIONS appears first (original module), TABLETS appears second (moved module) - order preserved based on placement sequence

steps.action: Hover over Content Layout to view column size indicators
steps.actual: Column sizes displayed: F30A_Pane1 (30%), F30A_Pane2 (20%), F30A_Pane3 (25%), F30A_Pane4 (25%)

steps.action: Observe pane labels and boundaries in Edit Mode
steps.expected: All panes clearly labeled and visible with edit boundaries
steps.actual: All pane labels visible (F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4, TopPane, ContentPane, LeftPane, RightPane, etc.) with dashed boundaries indicating editable areas

steps.action: Check for 'Add Existing Module' link in each pane
steps.expected: Each pane has 'Add Existing Module' link for adding modules
steps.actual: 'Add Existing Module' link visible in all panes (F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4, TopPane, ContentPane, etc.)

steps.action: Identify Content Layout modules on page
steps.expected: Content Layout modules identifiable by pane naming convention
steps.actual: Two Content Layout modules identified: First with F30A_Pane prefix (4 columns: 30-20-25-25), Second with 9977_Pane prefix (4 columns)

observations: Content Layout module creates dynamic panes with unique prefixes (e.g., F30A_, 9977_) to avoid conflicts with existing skin panes
Column sizes can be customized and are persisted (30-20-25-25 configuration observed)
Multiple modules can exist in a single Content Layout pane and are stacked vertically
Empty panes show placeholder icons for adding text, images, or modules
Move functionality supports moving modules to any available pane including Content Layout panes and skin panes
Two separate Content Layout modules were present on the Home page, each with their own pane prefix
9977_Pane1 contains two modules (CAMERAS and HOME THEATERS) demonstrating the multiple-modules-per-pane capability
Layout template selection appears to be handled through the LayoutEditor.js client-side functionality - no explicit UI template picker was found in the module actions menu
Column size adjustment appears to be available via drag handles (circles visible between columns) but direct width editing through numeric input was not tested
